Title: The best place I have ever worked
Pro: Lots of challenging problems to work on. Lots of really smart people to work with. And a really nice environment to work in. 3 meals a day - with varied menus and options. Fully stocked micro kitchens. 21 days vacation per year (plus sick days).
Con: While the site (in Menlo Park) is really nice, its difficult to get to - from almost anywhere. I hate my commute.

Title: Amazing company at the bleeding edge of media
Pro: Amazing company culture, ultra aligned vision, fantastic talented and motivated colleagues, entrepreneurial and "hacker" culture is very strong. Of course the perks are nice, but they are just there to remove distractions to allow you to focus on what matters. If you are attracted solely by perks, look elsewhere, you don't belong here.
Con: Hours can be long, but hey, you don't change the world by resting.

Title: No surprises
Pro: No surprises - Facebook is a great place to work. Clear vision from management, total autonomy to get your job done, fantastic perks and lots of career support.
Con: It can be hard to keep up with all of the information and changes. It can also be hard to wrap your head around the sheer scale of what we do and how fast things are growing.

Title: Best place to work
Pro:
- Coworkers are all smart and passionate people
- Managers truly care about their employees
- Flat organization
- Amazing perks
- Great benefits
- Schedule is very flexible
- Transparency
Con:
- Longer days (but you like what you do)
- Handful of entitled people

Title: Overall Good Company
Pro: One of the better internships to have. Compensation is probably the best of any of the major tech companies. Many small perks are included that really add up and make it a good work environment.
Con: Many people work 50+ hrs/week, depending on your team and location.

Title: Awesome company to work for
Pro:
- young, smart, helpful team
- great work culture (company values actually are being lived)
- focus is on making impact. company values your strength and not only that but also encourage you to find your strength and make impacts using that strength. of
Con: #NAME?

Title: I'm a Creative Shop Strategist and I love my job.
Pro:
- Working with smart, passionate, driven people.
- Working towards a collective issue.
- Working for incredible, transparent leaders (Zuck and Sheryl are amazing)
- The perks. Oh my god, the perks. Your quality of life is just better when you work for
Con: #NAME?

Title: Community Operations Contractor
Pro: Position was through PRO Unlimited, Inc. @ Facebook. Great place to work with a lot of in-house perks ... food/drinks etc.
Con:
Training was done by coworkers. You need to get up to speed immediately! Job was very demanding with a high quota to meet. M-F, Weekends and Holidays
Parking was horrible for downtown office location. Or you could take a bus or ride a bike.

Title: Exactly what I expected and still excited to be here
Pro:
- autonomy
- quality coworkers
- competitve pay and benefits
- good leadership, (we still get to see Mark quite often)
Con: #NAME?

Title: Recruiting
Pro: Top-notch benefits & perks, top of market compensation, learn a lot in a fast-paced way, huge amount of resources to tap into and learn from.
Con:
-Toxic environment of micromanagement, run like an agency (although it makes sense given the size of the org).
-Numbers-obsessed in contrast to being data-driven.
-Unrealistic expectations.
-Absolute no work/life balance, come in with the expectation o

Title: Some adventures are not worth taking
Pro:
free food, free t-shirts, free laundry, good pay.
If you're right out of college, this might be the place for you, but that's mostly because you wont have much work experience to compare it against.
Con:
1) the job I got is not the job I thought I was getting:
  As an engineer, with engineer in the title, and over 10 years of experience, I really thought I would get to do more engineering.  Unfortunately, the job is really about 50% business analyst and 20% project management, and 30% engineering.  You are expected to own every aspect of your project, regardless if anyone else actually does.  Also, you're told you have the opportunity to choose the team you want to be on, but for me, that choice was removed at the last minute.

2) bad management, bad leadership - all managers are expected to be individual contributors which is basically another way of saying that they aren't particularly good at either, and do not have time to devote to both roles.  Also, be prepared for mansplaining.

3) more money than sense:  gobs and gobs of money are being thrown around.  there's basically an offsite every other week.  Nevermind about work, deadlines, or being competent, it's more important to go glassblowing.  The pay is nice, in fact, its the best feature about the place.

4) the company that wants to connect the world would rather loose talent than have remote workers.  no, seriously.  say you're on a team, and your team decides to move to another office thats like 1 hour away.  you are kicked off the team and put on another team.  what sense does that make?  new mom wants to wfh?  not allowed. 
 Seriously, it's called skype, people.  

5) and speaking of teams, the team structure is completely whack.  instead of having a core group of people I work with on many projects, I have a different group of people I work with on each project.  a completely different set of swe, pm, ds, and de for each project.  This completely limits our ability to grow more efficient with each project, let alone build any sort of a professional relationship.

6) you're not allowed to fix things that are legit broken.  I've only been here a short time and have already had to suffer fools who prefer poorly designed metrics with political bs to actually measuring things properly.  bug 1 told not to fix it - too big to fail, bug 2, never got fixed by other team, bug 3, too high profile to fix.  seriously?  why not just admit all your metrics are wrong?

7) people care more about performance reviews than actual performance.  no really, if I hear the phrase make "an impact" I will vom.  What this really means is not "do good and useful work" which is how it might be interpreted, instead it means that you should very little on the very high profile projects, and then post it everywhere, to make sure people NOTICE.  Also, keep a log of your work so that you can share it with your absentee manager come review time - otherwise, he (yeah I said he) likely will have no idea what you worked on or why.  But, instead of this being a meaningful signal, it just becomes more noise.

Title: Great place to work!
Pro: It's the best company in the world to work for according to multiple reviews. Be prepared to move fast and agile (constant changes).
Con: As the company grew, the level of impact drops. Which causes people to focus more on what they "appear" to be doing vs what they are actually doing.

Title: Best company in the workd
Pro: Facebook take care of their employees period. From healthcare, perks, meals to compensation, Facebook is world class. Despite the negative press coverage, leadership genuinely want to do the right thing and instill a culture to do so.
Con: The only thing is you will gain weight due to how good Facebook’s free food for employees is.

Title: Loved every minute of my 4+ years at FB - would return in a heartbeat!
Pro: Culture, the people, the support, community, opportunities to learn, incredible benefits and perks - its a dream job.
Con: Growing very fast and opportunities for growth feel harder to come by with more people now than they did back in the early days when I started.

Title: Good company overall
Pro: Good benefit and overall culture. Feels excellent to work in an environment full of bright people.
Con: Smart braggers get their ways in often cases. Silent hard workers get bummed. This explains the lost of numerous extremely brilliant and hard working engineers, and the thrive of plenty of do-little but talk-a-lot people. All smart people, but the system is eventually encouraging appearance over everything else.

Title: Awesome place to work
Pro:
- Extremely competent people all around
- Lot of energy and motivation
- Strong sense of engineering and hacking culture
- Clear and transparent messaging from upper management
Con:
- Lot of work so you tend to be under pressure most of the time
- Be ready to feel average even if you have been a star at your previous job (Like I said everyone around you is really good)

Title: Awesome
Pro: The amount of freedom you get as an engineer is unlike anything I've seen. We have a culture that while going fast to build new things, strives to improve the codebase and overall code quality.
Con: There are still a lot of bugs in the code base. Some employees are quite harsh in their review of other people's work, but I'm willing to write this off to people wanting everyone else to be excellent.

Title: All That I Could Have Asked For and More
Pro:
- Choosing your own product team to work with
- Free food, medical plan, 401K, CalTrain passes, along with many other perks of a big tech company
- Company culture
- Strong management with a strong philosophy
- Beautiful campus
Con: - Expanding rapidly, so it could lose some of the "startup" feel

Title: Amazing
Pro: Besides the usual (brilliant people, delicious free meals for breakfast/lunch/dinner, beautiful campus, great benefits, cutting edge technology, etc..) I was surprised by how open the information transfer is from team to team and how much flexibility and options there are for career growth.
Con: Despite the great salary, the cost of living in the area is still a pain point.

Title: Focused and driven company with great rewards
Pro:
- Benefits are amazing
- Products are fun to work on
- Easy to determine the value added
- No bull atmosphere
Con:
- Things change very quickly, new features, new technologies
- No bull atmosphere takes getting used to
- A busy, moderately competitive atmosphere doesn't suit everyone. (I say moderately competitive, because it isn't politically competitive, but there

Title: Overall good
Pro: The working environment is very good. People are professional and helpful. As an intern you can learn a lot during the three-month internship. Many benefits and perks and the food is also very good.
Con: I find work-life balance depends on the specific team. I personally worked at a team that is at very fast peace, so it is hard for interns to keep pace unless you work overtime.

Title: Work Life Balance & Growth
Pro:
Work Life Balance
Flexibility 
Tons of Perks
Care for their employees
Awesome review cycles
Logistics of transport are on point
Awesome management
Flexibility
Con: Traffic & Parking is very tight/limited on the main campus in Menlo Park

Title: Best Job I've Ever Had
Pro: Surrounded by great people. Really interesting work. Amazing amenities. Good values woven into the fabric of the company. Transparent leaders who focus on the right stuff continually.
Con: Some people who have been at Facebook for a while seem to lose perspective about how lucky they are to work at a company like Facebook.

Title: Challenging, interesting, and delicious free food
Pro: Every day involves solving difficult problems with a bunch of very bright people. We're rewarded well for this, and everyone treats each other with mutual respect.
Con: People do work harder than at some other tech companies. Commuting in the Bay isn't overly fun.

Title: Sourcer
Pro:
Crazy pace of Growth
Opportunities to learn and gain new skills 
Working on cutting edge tech with other smart people 
Culture - accepting and caring. Transparent and open. 
Perks- benefits are great and lots of learning tools and new technologies available
Con:
Sometimes work life balance is crazy
Fast growth means navigating very complex environments with new hires who don’t know how things work yet. That can be frustrating but also rewarding

Title: Designer
Pro:
- Flexibility
- Autonomy
- Career growth opportunities
- Challenging work
- Smart teammates
- Amazing benefits
- Ability to bring your authentic self to work
- Work rewarded based on impact
Con:
- Accelerated hiring causes growing pains
- Lack of focus on collaboration causes work to be done in silos

Title: Great place to start a career
Pro:
- Mature engineering practice to scale the business while preserving quality
- Open and inclusive culture
- Very smart people
- Still lots of opportunities to grow
- Engineers get to decide what they want to work on
Con: #NAME?

Title: Excellent benefits and campus amenities cult like culture
Pro: Great benefits; work with superior talent; onsite food, snacks, and drinks provided; cool art; resources available for travel.
Con: Cult-like work environment must conform to what everyone else is doing to blend in; a lot of internal drama, greed and jealousy.

Title: Maximum impact
Pro:
If, like me, you are into building system at a huge scale, this is a dream come true

Super smart and nice colleagues makes it a great environment

All the awesome perks top it off
Con: You need to have self discipline and not be disturbed by a very dynamic environment. Do sign up and go to the gym so you don't end up gaining 15 pounds from the amazing free food, including delicious desserts.

Title: A great employer with outstanding perks and benefits that surrounds you with smart people
Pro: This is a very accommodating employer that really gives back to its employers.  I never feel like I'm going to work on a Monday.  As long as you're being impactful, you'll be recognized for your efforts.
Con: This company moves to fast that it is sometimes hard to keep up with all the changes and how it may affect what your responsibilities.

Title: Great company, lucky to have been a part of it
Pro: Literally everything - constant challenges, fast pace, smart people, great benefits, awe inspiring products, and the feeling like you are part of something that is once in a lifetime.
Con: Tolerates brilliant jerks and it can be easy to burn out based the intensity of workload.

Title: Culture
Pro: It matters: Facebook puts a premium of its people and the culture. It means people will treat you with respect and listen to your thoughts.
Con: Culture comes first. While we are all encouraged to be our authentic self, if your authentic self is an butt hole, don't bother applying. Sometimes we put feeling ahead of actions as we work through the culture piece. Overall, it is a great way to operate.

Title: Growth
Pro: At the rate the company is expanding, you have ample opportunity for personal growth as well
Con: Being that we are growing at such a rapid pace, I often read over company info on “scale management” to make sure I’m up to date with how my company is growing.

Title: Glad to be here, and grateful to stay here.
Pro: Great benefits, challenging environment, your voice is heard, management truly cares about developing people instead of just holding a manager title, and great perks at work!
Con: Sometimes because things move so fast and growth is happening exponentially, communications haven't been always trickled down with the best strategy in regards to getting everyone relevant in the loop before changes roll out.

Title: A Great Place to Work!
Pro:
FB hires the best people, so you are surrounded by seasoned professionals that are a pleasure to work with.
There is a lot of opportunity to make impact.
The company truly cares about its people.
Con: Because there is a lot of opportunity to make impact, there is a lot of work to do.  Sometimes projects take a little longer due to the fact there are many stakeholders involved.

Title: We redefine impact
Pro:
The strength is in the attitude and the commonality of intent. 
One of the most talented set of people I cross path with. 
Amazing alignment on the mission. 
The support network is solid and amplifies individuals strengths.
Awareness that we can be the crazy ones who are going to change the world, for the better.
Con: We are still in our teenage years in product design

Title: Moves fast, breaks things.
Pro:
* High impact job, each change touches millions of people
* High ownership, there's too much to do 
* Smart people to work with
* Great food and perks
* Low management overhead
* Lots of interesting problems to work on
Con:
* Long hours, hard work can be exhausting
* Very chaotic, plans can shift quickly, you have to be very flexible
* Other than that, nothing else

Title: Best first job imaginable
Pro: Great pay, amazing perks and benefits, super flexible scheduling.  You're very well taken care of at the office, food, drinks and snacks are free everywhere.  You pretty much tell them whatever equipment you want to work with, and they get it set up for you.
Con: It can be a little bit of a steep learning curve getting started.

Title: Fantastic Place to Work
Pro: Great place to work with great people. Incredibly open culture, can easily get involved in what you are interested in. Supported to learn and advance skills that align with your interests and goals.
Con: As an overall place to work, hard to think of cons. I guess the con of the open/hacky culture are occasional lack of structure/clarity.

Title: Amazing company
Pro:
It's exciting to build new products and features that millions of people use around the world. 
Fantastic coworkers and fancy offices to hang out in. The company really makes an effort to take care of us.
Con: The company grows and moves so fast that it's difficult to keep up with all that's going on.

Title: Facebook FTE
Pro: Working for a company that emphasizes equality, inclusion, and diversity so heavily has been such a great breath of fresh air. From day one Facebook made you feel apart of a family and it has been that since I started working for the company.
Con: Facebook does move very fast. Although I do not mind the fast pace, at times it could become overwhelming.

Title: Challenging, exciting work environment
Pro: The culture is incredible. Full of opportunity. Best place I have ever worked and hope to be here a very long time.
Con: Not a great place for people who are not open to change, as your work will constantly be changing and you need to adapt. Also not great for those who do not want to be challenged.

Title: Supportive Work Environment
Pro: I've been so impressed with how seamless, organized, and informative onboarding has been considering everyone has been remote. Even during these times, I have been checked in on regularly and I feel very supported by and included in my team. Everyone has been very warm and friendly. The company has been doing a lot of exciting things. The benefits are fantastic
Con: So far so good, no complaints :)

Title: Interesting experience working at an up-and-coming company like FB.
Pro: It is one of the fast growing company and things can move very fast. You could be doing different things if you happen to be at the right place at the right time.
Con: Less organization. Growing pain. Management needs to become mature.

Title: Great place to work.
Pro:
Open atmosphere.
Intelligent people.
Good food.
High level of respect for employees.
Always get the equipment we need.
No complaints.
Con: There aren't that many downsides so far. I occasionally find it hard to complete work on fridays, due to happy hour though ... :)

Title: Awesome Place to work
Pro: Very open culture. Great internal communication. Management does a good job of trusting and delegating work. The best people I have worked with. Fast pace of work. The high execution focus and speed of change is amazingly - I have worked on a large number of projects that have been quickly completed and and successfully implemented.
Con: None I can think of.

Title: I love working here, I really do.
Pro: The whole company cares and believes in our culture and values. Everyone is smart and passionate. An open community from Zuck on down. Mutual trust companywide and sense of community and drive, instilled by our CEO who we all truly respect.
Con: Odd requests from people and weird questions about working at fb.

Title: Excellent place to work at.
Pro:
- Get to work with some of the most brilliant computer engineers
- Impact: harder to find a place where your work touches more than a billion people
- Open culture: you have all the freedom to work on things other than your project
- Scale: get to work
Con: None that come to my mind.

Title: Great place to work
Pro: It's so inspiring to work with so many professional and smart people in such a free atmosphere. Every project you're working on is both challenging and interesting.
Con: Basically I find it hard to complain about Facebook. Although I heard someone complained about the work/life balance, I really feel at ease about it and it depends on the team you're working on.

Title: Best place to work at
Pro:
1) Co-workers are all crazy talented and top of the industry
2) Working on some really technically interesting and challenging problems
3) Anything you do affect up to a billion people!
Con: The location of the office is the biggest drawback, it's in the middle of nowhere with no good housing nearby

Title: Connecting the World
Pro: Great company to work for.  You work on projects that interest and challenge you.  Fast paced & teams expect you to work hard and meet your goals.
Con: There is no downside to a great company making the world a better place.

Title: Best job so far.
Pro: Given the room to make the role what you want. You have the freedom to find something you find interesting and run with it.
Con: Long onboarding process might be a turn off to some people.other than that the company is about as good as it gets.

Title: Good place to work
Pro: Nice and passionate people. Lots of work for engineers. Many opportunities. Many supports for employees. Many of employees are smart.
Con: Normally busy. Inexperienced engineers sometimes lead the project, which causes a mess. People move too fast and break things, which is not good for engineering perspective.

Title: Excellent company to work for.
Pro:
Perks Perks Perks!!!!
The interview process is long and grueling but for good reason. You will find the best of the best working here.
The pay is above the industry standard.
Freedom to work on projects you are interested in.
Con: I don't see any cons here.

Title: Better than expected
Pro:
• Great culture
• Very smart people around 
• Amazing teammates 
• Flexibility to choose teams/projects at the beginning and later very easy to switch if you like.
• Great resources within the company to keep learning 
• Great perks (specially the food, it’s awesome and free)
Con: Most offices are cold, don’t know why but it’s annoying to have to wear a jacket in the middle of the summer

Title: Exactly what I expected and still excited to be here
Pro:
- autonomy
- quality coworkers
- competitve pay and benefits
- good leadership, (we still get to see Mark quite often)
Con: #NAME?

Title: Great place to work!
Pro: It's the best company in the world to work for according to multiple reviews. Be prepared to move fast and agile (constant changes).
Con: As the company grew, the level of impact drops. Which causes people to focus more on what they "appear" to be doing vs what they are actually doing.

Title: Best company in the workd
Pro: Facebook take care of their employees period. From healthcare, perks, meals to compensation, Facebook is world class. Despite the negative press coverage, leadership genuinely want to do the right thing and instill a culture to do so.
Con: The only thing is you will gain weight due to how good Facebook’s free food for employees is.

Title: Mid-level management mentally ill
Pro: The on-the-ground staff are the best in the world, great ability to move from team to team, great compensation, fantastic resources, company perks and benefits.
Con: Director level management is filled with mentally ill and incompetent narcissists and sociopaths who make terrible product decisions and make the lives of their direct reports a nightmare with randomized decisions and needless conflicts and drama. Terrible work life balance with expectation to be available 24/7.

Title: Software Engineer
Pro: Everything Is Good, Most Great Is The Free Food &  Maternity Paternity 4 Months Paid Leave, No Force To Join Work Back.
Con: I Found No Cons, A Great Company To Work With. Tough To Get A Job That's All About Facebook.

Title: Advertising
Pro: The privilege working in a highly dynamic and engaging environment while bring surrounded by some of the smartest co-workers in the business. A truly open company that cares about it workers and consumers.
Con: No cons are worth detailing in comparison to the massive positives at Facebook today. Facebook just needs to keep up the good work maintaining that culture as they continue to scale.

Title: Tough and rewarding
Pro:
Smart, motivated colleagues who are great to work with
Fast paced environment where you can make a real difference 
Big challenges to tackle
Awesome office environment. Seriously, check out pictures.
Con: Extremely high bar for success. You need to be great to be average. Everyone is smart and motivated so don't expect to work 9-5.

Title: Engineering Manager
Pro:
Great benefits. 
Fast paced work environment. 
Competitive salary and stock
Con:
Stressful - most people are expected to be available all of the time.
People are passionate but that comes with a down side of not wanted to listen to other people's opinion.
Profanity is part and parcel of working here.

Title: Best Place To Work. Period.
Pro: Open culture. Ability to grow, fast. Transparency. As amazing as the perks are, the day to day of Facebook is what keeps me here. This is the best place I have ever worked, bar none.
Con: None. This is truly a special place to work.

Title: Software Engineer
Pro:
Awesome free food (3 times a day high quality breakfast, lunch and dinner, made fresh from scratch with organic ingredients)
Smart and driven people to work with
Insane compensation (mind blowing!)
A strong culture of fairness
Strong bottom-up work culture
Impact driven, much less politics than other companies
Con: Intense environment, highly demanding, but also highly rewarding

Title: Great place
Pro: Wellness reimbursement, lots of opportunities, interesting work, generous relocation policies, good compensation
Con: I think the greatest con is that HQ is in Menlo Park - living in the surrounding areas is so so expensive and pretty boring if you are young and single or used to city life. Otherwise, you can move to SF which means you end up with a crazy commute.

Title: Recruiting
Pro: Incredible health insurance covered 100%, free breakfast/lunch/dinner every day, work life balance, flexibility to work from home, unlimited sick days, career growth
Con: Nothing that really comes to mind

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Benefits were awesome, and you do work with super smart and driven people.  The culture discourages typical political crap and most people are super friendly and collaborative.
Con: The company is so huge that decisions you make can have negative impacts on society (to be fair can have positive impacts as well).  Need only look to the 2016 election for examples.

Title: Good place for growth
Pro:
- Little politics.
- Care for employees happiness.
- Engineer centric.
- Easy to move across teams and projects.
- Easy to give feedback.
- Lot of support.
- Transparency.
- Perks.
Con:
- Little appetite  to risk.
- Focused on short term goals/projects.
- Disconnect between consecutive halves.

Title: Best Work So Far
Pro: Great perks.  When they say the company cares for you, they really do.  They are understanding and supporting in decisions.  They empower you to make the career you want based on your performance.
Con: There's so much info.  You need to take the time to really dig in and understand all the information that's coming at you.  Filter what to prioritize.

Title: Opportunity galore for your unique strengthes\\s
Pro:
Expert colleagues
Opportunity for you to carve out where your unique strength can help the company
Con:
Large org with confusing at first org chart
High level processes, but not enough lower level process (opportunity here!)

Title: A Great Place to Work
Pro: I have never worked at a place that is so focused on putting people first. Attention to IC concerns and provision of IC autonomy is first rate. ICs are offered the opportunity to change teams if they are unhappy with their own. Company perks abound. Opportunities to make impact abound. Great people, great environment.
Con: Can't think of any cons.

Title: One of the best, if not the best place to work!
Pro:
Great benefits and perks.
Great culture.
Interesting projects.
Big on employee growth and development. 
Very collaborative work environment.
Great parties to help employees take some time away from the office.
Con: No complaints yet.  Company is always focused on getting better.  If I had to choose, I would say there aren't enough food options? ;)

Title: Awesome company and benefits
Pro: Lots of autonomy and freedom to take risks.
Con: Sometimes feels like being in high school or college because a lot of employees are cliquey, immature and right out of college. Very hard to move up and favoritism on certain teams.

Title: Great culture and awesome teammates
Pro: The leadership thinks in very innovative and novel ways. Teammates are very highly qualified. It is not just a place for the uber-geeks, people with all proficiencies and skill sets work coherently to achieve the Facebook mission.
Con: Too many benefits. Sometimes seems like the unique evaluation system based on "impact" is too subjective.

Title: Fortunate to work for this company.
Pro: A company that truly takes care if its people! The benefits, the compensation, the perks but above all its the people that make this place great.
Con: Experiencing huge growth. You need to be able to adapt to change easily and be patient as the groom new leaders.

Title: Great benefits
Pro: Free meals, amazing benefits package, great office culture, fun employee events
Con: Not a lot of room for non-technical junior full time roles, lack of upward mobility

Title: Great company to work for!
Pro: Great benefits, culture, mission. There is a lot to love about working at Facebook. Most employees believe strongly in the mission.
Con: Commute from SF is tough, and manager support is pretty hit or miss depending on the person. You have to stick up for yourself and be proactive if you want to learn.

Title: Impact-Oriented Company
Pro: Ability to drive impact from day one. Incredibly lean teams, great management exposure, people bring their authentic selves. Fantastic wellness benefits, amazing restaurants on campus, great shuttle service throughout the Bay.
Con: Limited conference/meeting rooms, number of reorgs/changes to business operations, large number of visitors/guests on campus

Title: The Best Company I've worked so far
Pro:
As a company, Facebook cares about their employees. I feel excited about heading in to work each morning!

Opportunities for learning and growth, flexibility to work on projects you're passionate about, Smart Peers,  Superb benefits, wonderful campus, Gender equity!
Con: Although I love the fast-paced environment, some people might suffer from imposter syndrome. Work-life balance might be an issue for some people.

Title: Facebok TL;DR
Pro:
- Wonderful food
- A company culture encouraging absolute openness
- No red tape, in terms of work, resources, people
- Opportunities to get together with other employees to hack on what interests you
- Freedom to work from home and to come into work
Con:
- Parking
- Neighboring houses dislike us
- Terribly inefficient and large number of e-mails
- Too much 'The Son of Man' around the office

Title: Best place I've ever worked.
Pro: Unlimited opportunity: you define your path.Surrounded by the best and the brightest. Moving fast. Amazing perks.
Con: Tireless hours. The work never stops.

Title: Startup-up culture still evident, but hitting growing pains
Pro: Fast paced, high impact, lots of freedom to pursue directions you find interesting, awesome data set, the ability to have an idea and see it implemented and affecting real people in weeks or months instead of years
Con: Work/life balance not great, overarching "connect the world" goal pretty consistent and clear, but specific direction is often lacking and/or inconsistent.

Title: Great People, Great Mission, Feeling a bit big at the moment.
Pro: Great culture, lots of learning opportunities, good people, good mission.
Con: Often tone-deaf to real-world (non-SV) problems; undergoing significant growing pains; lots of outside hires for upper management positions; increasing eng/non-eng/sales splits

Title: Best experience of my career life.
Pro: 1. a mission that has meaning to me, 2. smart people I learn from, 3. big challenges to tackle every day.
Con: I have to carefully manage my time. I don't like to think of it as work/life balance because that's not realistic but work/life integration is very achievable and something I constantly have to work at.

Title: Work
Pro: Facebook is a great company with awesome perks.  Perks are similar to Google's so you will be well taken care of in those terms.  Also, the pay is very good.
Con: Management tends to over complicate things.  A lot more layers of management then when I first started two years ago.

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Even as an intern, I was able to work on high-impact projects for the caching infrastructure. All the people at Facebook are really talented engineers.
Con: Sometimes, it can get pretty daunting for an intern. Facebook has a ton of internal tools and a lot of internal documentation, and it is easy for an intern to get lost in the myriad of internal stuff.

Title: Work hard, play hard
Pro: Some of the best compensation and perks in tech, together with huge impact and incredibly smart people.
Con: Performance-based culture leads to poor work/life balance. Performing at senior engineering levels is very hard. No free time for self-development and/or infrastructure improvement; too much focus on continuous fast moving forward.

Title: Great Product thinkers ... in a bubble
Pro: Helped to deeply refine my sense of product design. Allowed me the opportunity to work on deeply impactful work early in my career.
Con: Fb is a very large company and often if you're not in a position of top leadership you can feel like you don have much control over the products or teams you work with

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Push code daily, work with extremely talented engineers, free food, great compensation, and seeing everyone I know use the product
Con: Long hours but Facebook engineers tend to be the type who passionately enjoy their work and build products for fun anyways

Title: Move Fast
Pro:
-fast moving culture
-not much bureaucracy
-great benefits and perks
-working on an exciting, consumer facing, product
-lots of impact
Con:
-fast moving culture can be hard to keep up with at times
-need thick skin when it comes to what you're coding because you'll get a lot of employee feedback. people are generally perfectionists.

Title: best place to work at
Pro: openness, freedom to choose work & define ones own career path. especially miscellaneous fringe benefits for pursuing extra curricular activities of ones choice
Con: everyone focuses on immediate impact. this can prove to be a bane in the long run, if one does not occasionally stop, slow down to pay the technical debt

Title: Program Manager
Pro: Good Benefits, Beautiful Campus, Good Food.  The company really does a good job of providing every resource you need to do your job.
Con: If you want to devote 50+ hrs a week to helping your Aunt Ginny post photos of her cat all so that Frito Lay can sell more Cheetos; then it's where you need to be.  Nothing more than a sophisticated digital billboard slinging crap we don't need.  Working at Facebook is like shoving a handful of Jolly Ranchers in your mouth while drinking orange soda; sickeningly sweet and eventually regrettable.

Title: Overall Happy
Pro:
- Great Benefits
- Collaborative Environment
- Transparency from leadership
- High hiring bar - you really are working with the best and the brightest!
- Strong company mission that is truly reflected throughout the company
Con:
- very hands off management approach (some might like this)
- frequent reorganizations (maybe due to frequent manager changes because of growth)
- lacking a diverse workforce (although this is changing)

Title: PhD Intern at Facebook
Pro: Great people to work with, lots of learning opportunities. Interesting projects.
Con: unbalance load of work. faulty ways of measuring the productivity of engineers.

Title: 5 years in and still loving it!
Pro:
- Hard problems
- Strong management/mentorship
- Tons of resources
- Strong company values
- Excellent executive leadership (Mark/Sheryl/Schrep/Cox)
- Focus on diversity
- Food and general benefits are top of the charts
- Flexible work schedule
Con: - Commute is O.K.; I find it productive but friends who get carsick, less ideal

Title: IC6
Pro: smart people, good vacation, benefits.   shuttle busses to work to avoid traffic. 3 meals a day, but then you're at work 10 hours.
Con: very very big, beaurocracy creeping in fast.

Title: Best company I worked so far!
Pro:
+ Great environment, you are surrounded by world class engineers who are excellent colleagues
+ Culture: Move fast, be bold and make impact, collaborative
+ Meritocracy, less politics 
+ Lot of freedom, company still doesn't have lot of processes
Con: #NAME?

Title: Administrative Assistant
Pro: Treated with respect, lots of flexibility, encouraged to grow and play to your strengths
Con: Desire to perform is so high it makes it hard to have work life balance. But being committed to our mission isn't a bad thing.

Title: Company promotes openness n boldness
Pro: Open culture, good benefits , good brand to associate with. Free food.flexible work hours, good pay. Xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx
Con: Don’t work for bizapps.its worst team in Facebook. Leaders are not competent and upto date with new technology. Too much of show off to pretend we are best.

Title: Great place to work
Pro: We have amazing benefits, but the work environment is what make me love most the company. Managers want to help you grow and will support you in new projects.
Con: I don't have a negative point to mention about Facebook.

Title: Software Engineer
Pro: Everything Is Good, Most Great Is The Free Food &  Maternity Paternity 4 Months Paid Leave, No Force To Join Work Back.
Con: I Found No Cons, A Great Company To Work With. Tough To Get A Job That's All About Facebook.

Title: Advertising
Pro: The privilege working in a highly dynamic and engaging environment while bring surrounded by some of the smartest co-workers in the business. A truly open company that cares about it workers and consumers.
Con: No cons are worth detailing in comparison to the massive positives at Facebook today. Facebook just needs to keep up the good work maintaining that culture as they continue to scale.

Title: Tough and rewarding
Pro:
Smart, motivated colleagues who are great to work with
Fast paced environment where you can make a real difference 
Big challenges to tackle
Awesome office environment. Seriously, check out pictures.
Con: Extremely high bar for success. You need to be great to be average. Everyone is smart and motivated so don't expect to work 9-5.

Title: Engineering Manager
Pro:
Great benefits. 
Fast paced work environment. 
Competitive salary and stock
Con:
Stressful - most people are expected to be available all of the time.
People are passionate but that comes with a down side of not wanted to listen to other people's opinion.
Profanity is part and parcel of working here.

Title: Best Place To Work. Period.
Pro: Open culture. Ability to grow, fast. Transparency. As amazing as the perks are, the day to day of Facebook is what keeps me here. This is the best place I have ever worked, bar none.
Con: None. This is truly a special place to work.

Title: Software Engineer
Pro:
Awesome free food (3 times a day high quality breakfast, lunch and dinner, made fresh from scratch with organic ingredients)
Smart and driven people to work with
Insane compensation (mind blowing!)
A strong culture of fairness
Strong bottom-up work culture
Impact driven, much less politics than other companies
Con: Intense environment, highly demanding, but also highly rewarding

Title: Great place
Pro: Wellness reimbursement, lots of opportunities, interesting work, generous relocation policies, good compensation
Con: I think the greatest con is that HQ is in Menlo Park - living in the surrounding areas is so so expensive and pretty boring if you are young and single or used to city life. Otherwise, you can move to SF which means you end up with a crazy commute.

Title: Recruiting
Pro: Incredible health insurance covered 100%, free breakfast/lunch/dinner every day, work life balance, flexibility to work from home, unlimited sick days, career growth
Con: Nothing that really comes to mind

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Benefits were awesome, and you do work with super smart and driven people.  The culture discourages typical political crap and most people are super friendly and collaborative.
Con: The company is so huge that decisions you make can have negative impacts on society (to be fair can have positive impacts as well).  Need only look to the 2016 election for examples.

Title: Good company - moves fast but with a lot of churn.
Pro: Moves fast; always innovating.  Pay is great.
Con: Many initiatives are started and shutdown with a short period of time.  You have to chose your projects, teams and skillsets wisely.

Title: Amazing company, nothing like it!
Pro:
People oriented
Good hiring strategy that attracts the best and brightest
Great pay and so many benefits
Little politics and a lot of support
Con: Company growing fast and not all the processes are well defined

Title: Amazing Company
Pro:
- great food
- amazing office
- amazing opportunities to grow
- lots of interesting topics to work on
Con:
- the Menlo Park campus is like a golden cage, so after some time it feels like living inside a bubble
- a lot of people outside of Facebook will have a opinion about Facebook and will make sure to let you know

Title: What more could you want?
Pro:
- coworkers are smart, dependable, and genuinely enjoy what they do
- management cares about empowering employees and helping them develop
- benefits and perks make life fun
- chance to have a huge impact and not be just another cog in the machine
- o
Con: still working through some growing pains

Title: The best tech company, period.
Pro: Employee benefits basically increase salary, environment is free and open
Con: Intern training (bootcamp) is insufficient in terms of time and content

Title: This is the best place I ever worked with
Pro: The best thing about this place is that you have so many smart people around you. You can learn from the best, working on the most interesting products for 1B of people.
Con: Food, definitely. It's so good and available so easily you can gain a stone or two quite quickly.

Title: Best Company Ever
Pro: Mission.  Leadership.  Values are lived, not just talked about.  Good compensation, benefits and perks.
Con: Commute is long from San Francisco.  Other than that, I really don't have any cons.

Title: Nonsense company
Pro: Good perks and other facilities like food is awesome, transport and other perks.
Con: Egoistic managers, management never pays any heed to employee concern. Politics is too much.

Title: Awesome place to work
Pro:
- Great culture.  
- Inspiring leadership
- Excellent autonomy -- teams are self-empowered to define success and how to get the work done
- Totally ridiculous benefits -- especially if you are lucky to work on the main campus in Menlo Park
Con:
- Hard to think of cons
- One area may be investing in developing more people management skills for people managers.

Title: The best tech company to work for
Pro:
Many interesting engineering problems to work on.
Many smart coworkers.
Ideas come from engineers bottom up.
Open culture.
Awesome perks.
Con:
WLB may not be the best depending on what team to are on.
Rapid hiring creates office space problem in MPK. New building opening up next year will reduce the problem.

Title: Still a great place to work
Pro: Responsive management, transparent pay scales, autonomy, big investments in training and growth opportunities, excellent facilities team, great support staff, collaboration and consensus culture baked in.
Con: Sloppy internal tools, quip, buggy calendars

Title: Once in a lifetime opportunity I would not pass up
Pro: Rare to have the chance to work for a company that captures the imagination of the world such as Facebook.
Con: Well, you can't be afraid of hard work and a challenge and to be pushed out of your comfort zone

Title: working with smart people
Pro: It is good to work here with the smartest people in San Francisco bay area. The company is always moving fast.
Con: Sometimes it is moving too fast. The food in cafe can be better, but the snacks in micro-kitten are really good.

Title: The best company to work ever
Pro:
You met with a ton of smart and friendly co-worker and managers.
You can make a lot of impact and also grow yourself.
Con:
Too much food, way too easy to gain weight.
You need to make decision yourself most of the time, sometimes it's intimidating.

Title: The best one out there
Pro: If you are an engineer, you owe it to yourself to work at Facebook at some point of time. Super smart collegue, minimal BS and super high impact.
Con:
* Growing too fast.
* Hacky culture doesn't bound well for code quality.

Title: I love this place!
Pro: Facebook is an amazing place to work. The culture, the people, and the immense impact you can have on almost 1.5 billion people is unparalleled.
Con: To me, the one con is the time it takes to get down to Menlo Park from San Francisco.

Title: Awesome place, great opportunity
Pro:
The culture is awesome, you become a member of a group of talented, smart and entrepeneur people.
People in leadership positions are always reachable and the treat you as a colleague.
Con: Probably, the worst part for me, was that we couldn´t work on sundays ;)

Title: Good people who believe in positive impact
Pro:
Mission driven
Incredible management training 
Assume good intent 
Choose your career path and manager
Flexible work schedule
Life / work balance 
Benefits 
Creative and smart and ridiculously talented people
Con: The media has latched on and won’t let go easily. We move so fast, sometimes we miss big things. We’re solving for things that have never before even been considered.

Title: Amazing!!
Pro: It provides you with the best possible space and to divulge into your specialties. The only thing you are required to do is to do what you have been asked to do in a completely pressure free atmosphere. Its more like work at home!!!
Con: There are none. Its a fantastic place to work for people willing to make money by enjoying.

Title: Best job I've ever had
Pro:
Code ships quickly
Every engineer has a lot of impact on products
Easy to move between teams
Engineers are encouraged to find teams where they have the most impact
Very smart co-workers
Con: If you're used to a cruisy corporate job, this is not the place for you

Title: Do not join the recruiting team, the rest of company is pretty good.
Pro: There are tons of perks but after 3yrs it doesn't matter if you are not happy with the team, job or the way you are treated.
Con: I have many but I'll keep this short. I'd say the biggest problem is the recruiting managment and also the lack of growth opportunities.

Title: Nirvana
Pro: Facebook encourages openness in all spheres, professional and personal.  Be yourself - don't lead a double life where you are dull & droid-like at work, then are someone different at home.
Con: It's too early for me to tell.  I hear rumblings that justifying code cleanup can be difficult since there's no neat metric for it.

Title: Relaxed environment
Pro: A lot of freedom, relaxed environment, surrounded by smart people, fun hackathons!
Con:
The food is delicious but watch your waistline...
Diversity issues - my team was made of up mostly white males.

Title: Amazing company for Leaders
Pro: Fast-paced environment, brilliant people,  amazing opportunities for learning and career growth.  New challenges every day and the most wonderful people working together to find solutions.
Con: Fast pace is really fast and the company is growing very quickly.  The need to continuously  grow yourself and to scale yourself is very high.

Title: Recruiting Coordinator
Pro: Flexible schedule, great culture and benefits!
Con: Some teams do not have a lot of processes in place recruiting-wise so if you work on one team and transition to another, you will likely need to re-learn a new way of doing some things... but if you can adapt to change, it won't be an issue for you.

Title: Best work of your career
Pro:
Amazing work and meaningful challenges
Solid people and community
Con: Intense workload so you need to manage your time well to have good balance

Title: No Regrets
Pro: Ambitious company with ambitious goals; Truly cares of its staff of employees AND business partners; Most talented group of people; Seeks out opportunities and encourages the same in its employees; Outstanding benefits and care!
Con: Some locations are difficult e.g. Bay Area housing is difficult and some sites are less than glamorous.

Title: This place is no joke.
Pro: Empowerment.  Real and immediate impact, high level of responsibility. Assumption of good intentions.  Fun. People genuinely like each other.
Con: The focus on "most fast" sometimes leaves things undone.

Title: Change is the norm
Pro: Fast paced, smart people, innovative, great perks and benefits! The challenges presented ahead are still very compelling things to work on.
Con: As the company grows, it's losing the 'startup' feel. You can definitely still get exposed to multiple areas of the business.

Title: Greatest Company I Have Ever Worked For!
Pro:
+ A single individual can make a huge impact within the company and on the world
+ Ideas are listened to and hacking is encouraged
+ No red tape & really fast paced
+ Great compensation & perks
Con: #NAME?

Title: The world is your oyster
Still a great place to work
Pro: Even after 4.5 years, the work is inspiring and the new challenges are exciting.  Still the smartest employees in the business with a broad view of the world, which allows the company to serve many different cultures.
Con: Miss the small company atmosphere of knowing everyone and getting down and dirty on multiple projects at once.

Title: Simply fantastic.
Pro:
Great coworkers - i've never enjoyed meetings so much (even when we topics are disagreeable)
Incredibly challenging work - I feel like I accomplish a week's worth of work in one day.
Con: Everything constantly changes.  Not a terrible thing - just something for most people to realize if you don't like change.

Title: Software Engineer
Pro: Best place to work, total freedom on kind of work, great culture and values, brilliant people and awesome food.
Con: Company is trying to retain same culture as we grow and it is becoming harder every year with so much growth. Hopefully it stays same and we will able to grow.

Title: Great place to work
Pro: All tge benefits, very smart people, great problems to work on, infinite amount of data
Con: You might feel like second class citizen if you are not SWE

Title: You Matter Here
Pro: This is truly a company that cares about your ideas and strengths. You have a real voice here, and your ideas and input are taken seriously. Its also a great place to continuously develop, become part of n amazing community, and make a difference on a global scale.
Con: I can not think of any.

Title: Great engineering culture
Pro:
Blameless engineering culture focused on growth and learning.
Fast paced, continuous updates to prod throughout the day.
Great pay, benefits, and campuses.
Great commute options including shuttles.
Con: Can be unsettling at first to experienced engineers.

Title: Contractor converting to FTE
Pro:
Excellent benefits
Fast-paced, interesting projects
Management is supportive (safe work environment, good work/life balance, happy and functional team)
Unending opportunities for career growth
Con: Your role and projects may not be well defined. If you are not proactive and willing to take ownership this may not be a great fit.

Title: The best place to work for an engineer in the bay area
Pro: You work along some of the brightest talent in the Silicon Valley. There are hardly any politics around you and get to make an impact in your first few days. Great perks + benefits.
Con: 1. Company is growing up fast and it'll be tricky to maintain the culture.

Title: open culture big impact
Pro:
* open flow of information within the company
* ability to have big impact as soon as you join
* get to work with and learn from a bunch of brilliant people
Con: * fast company growth can be turbulent in areas where the company has not figured out how it wants to handle it

Title: Exciting, innovative work. Great colleagues.
Pro: As titled. Also, the company is still growing pretty fast, so there is plenty of opportunities to make big impact.
Con: Sometimes, people compete too much internally, which could be put stress on some people. The infrastructure still needs some work to be more robust.

Title: Developer's heaven
Pro:
Amazing people
Freedom to do what you want, move between projects
Cheerful and optimistic work-environment
Find something you want to hack/change, go do it
Good food
Lots of perks
Con:
Sugar-shop is hard to resist 
HQ Office in the middle of nowhere
Commute on 101 is a pain
Sometimes work environment gets pretty noisy with all the discussions going on around you

Title: Smart People, Great Culture
Pro: The Perks are nice, but what is very valuable is the people I work with.  Everyone is top notch and I'm learning a lot every day.
Con: There are a lot of people who touch each project making it hard to execute quickly.

Pro: Strong leadership. Lots of autonomy. Intelligent and caring colleagues.
Con: It doesn't matter how hard working you're you are going to be surrounded with a lot of other people who are just as good as you're

Title: Manager, Enterprise Engineering
Pro: Fantastic environment!  Awesome people!  Great food!  Extremely supportive!  Unbelievable Tech!
Con: Large tech stack to learn that is still Facebook specific in many cases even though much has been open sourced.  More outdated documentation exists than I would like.

Title: Not a good place for seasoned professionals
Pro:
- benefits and perks
- endless food options
- global reach and impact

At Facebook, you have the opportunity to work on products that everyone uses. This helps you use and sharpen your skills in an entirely new way, and really think through your logic
Con:
- politics and back channeling 
- competitiveness and lack of collaboration 
- relationships hold more value than quality work

Facebook the company is like the platform: everyone acts like everything is great, but no one acknowledges or exposes what

Title: What a wonderful place
Pro:
- Flexible work hours
- Supportive management / leaders
- Transparency 
- Collaborative teams
- Growth opportunities galore 
- Food, gyms, other perks
- High pay
Con: - Imposter syndrome (but this is not a company faulted thing, it's just the fact that we work amongst some of the smartest and most talented people in the world)

Title: Chaos
Pro:
- Everyone is smart and very hardworking
- Facebook is a great company to work
Con:
- The PSO organization excluding ProdOps is a complete mess with no structure . 
- limited career growth
- HR is not helpful and will always side with your manager 
- There is no work life balance, and you will always be stressed 
- Your performance i

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Great work culture. People here are very understanding and are invested in your learning. There's a lot of room to grow here, and the benefits are the best out of any company I've worked for
Con: Not that many. I'm not a fan of writing code in PHP/hack, but there are other options.

Title: Open culture
Pro:
1. Great team matching process called bootcamp when you have couple months to talk to different team and shop round before making the decision about which team to join.
2. Fairly easy to internally change teams to try different things and keep growth.
3. Great cafes.
Con: Depending on teams, some team may have bad work life balance.

Title: Emphasized More on Impact than Engineer Excellency
Pro:
- Great Facility & Perks
- Competitive Compensation
Con: -  The company is too big and communications are valued far more important than technical skills. Impact focused culture makes the management rewards people who spent more time talking/writing docs, having meetings. It's getting more and more political. H

Title: wonderful place to work
Pro:
-management is approachable and open with information
-perks are outstanding (health, pto, food, company events, laundry services, etc)
-employees are among the brightest in the industry
-exciting work environment
Con:
-inconsistency in quality reviews
-rapid employee growth means less personal peer-to-peer relationships

Title: High Quality Employment
Pro: FB tries to eliminate regular discomforts one can experience in less progressive corporate employment. Management is easy-going but in return one is expected to do quality work.
Con: FB is a large company and with that, it is sometimes hard to see the impact of the work given.

Title: Nice
Pro:
Great perks, friendly work environment, free food and gym.
The company moves fast, nice opportunities to learn and improve yourself.
Con: The company is more focused on web development and has less product/project diversity than other companies like Google or Microsoft.

Title: I've worked at a lot of places; this is the best
Pro: Coworkers are really smart, politics is minimal, and focus is on what you can accomplish that will help the company.
Con: If you're working in California, the rent and commute aren't great. The East coast offices are where its at.

Title: Nothing more important than moving fast
Pro: Flexible hours.  Healthy food, dynamic/ energetic environment.  Working with top-notch engineers/ analysts in the world.
Con: Work/ Life balance is very challenging.  When your boss pings you, they expect you to respond within few seconds; managers would put you on the spot all the time in order to drive you.  Things changed very fast with many re-orgs.  The whole working environment is very competitive, not much personal level connection w/ colleagues.   Top priority is to get things done fast, morality is low.

Title: Some of the most amazing people I've encountered!
Pro:
- Incredible colleagues
- Senior managements is unbelievably transparent, honest and accountable. 
- A lot of people are very mission-oriented
- Great place to build the products of the future
Con: Rent around the company HQ is super high.

Title: Biggest Con: It's So Great Working Here, You Will Never Want To Leave
Pro:
- generous compensation/benefits
- manager support and transparency
- autonomy - you can create your own career path
- interesting, challenging work
- investment from the company to create/maintain a great culture
Con: - The company is growing so fast, it's hard to scale at this pace

Title: Enterprise Engineer
Pro:
Awesome perks
Exciting and dynamic environment
Great learning experience
Very causal and friendly employees
Chance to work with the best in the world
Con: At Every step, have to learn by yourself. Everything is mostly self service. So its hard if you not good with technology.

Title: Great company to work at!
Con: I can't really see any cons apart from the headquarters being in Menlo Park. I wish they would open more infrastructure engineering roles on the San Francisco office as well.

Title: It's fine. It's not heaven.
Pro: Opportunity for impact. Rapid product growth. Competitive pay and benefits. Somewhat transparent. Nice rooftop garden. I enjoyed the free, healthy food options and onsite gyms.
Con: Expectations of long hours. Growing pains. As the company scales, toxic individuals are allowed to stay on teams. Decisions tend to be more top down. The shine of a lot of the perks wear off quickly. There's a crazy push to be outwardly/overly optimistic and not to point out problems. Dissenters are pushed out pretty fast.

Title: It's the best job I've ever had.
Pro: The culture and environment is amazing.  Everyone is empowered and responsible, there's no politics or overly restrictive processes or oppressive management oversite.
Con: The pace can be exhausting.  It can be very stressful.  You have to get used to all the media attention and mudslinging.

Title: Great Place to work
Pro:
Fast paced
Exciting projects
Fast expansion (Still)
Transparent Environment
Nice and kind managers
thoughtful management 

Career opportunity is definitely better than Google but fewer than other start ups.
But a lot of great people to learn from.
Con: bonus is not as high as I thought and seems no stock refresh program?

Title: Awesome place to work
Pro: Work on a product used by Billions, run by a CEO and executive team of rockstars. Mission driven, Flexible, cutting edge products used by people, developers, publishers, advertisers etc. Awesome perks.
Con: Long commute from SF to HQ, Company getting large now and it's harder to work on most impactful products.

Title: Never Gonna Give You Up
Pro: Personal and family leave, growth opportunities, open environment, friendly atmosphere, work from home Wednesdays, ethical business practices, unlimited sick days, diverse staff.
Con: You need to love what you're doing here because it moves FAST.

Title: Great if you are young...
Pro: Great perks, interesting challenges, dynamic environment
Con: Open floor plan is not for everyone, hard to concentrate

Title: Great place to work
Pro: I work on things that I find very interesting and have few boundaries towards success. The perks/benefits are huge, and I really appreciate the free meals.
Con: Can err on the sides of being too results oriented half to half, and I am worried about the company's direction in open source.

Title: Great culture and leadership from the top
Pro: #NAME?
Con: There are bad eggs anywhere, but FB generally does a good job of calling those people out. Sometimes we overpivot on the feelings aspect and lose some good people.

Title: Positive Feedback
Pro:
Best company for an intern! Everything is free and there is a good hotel to live!
Worked on an independent project. (This is really good compare to some interns in Canada..)
Con:
Really good company and no big cons..
Ok.. food is not good as heard..

Title: Fun Perks, High Energy, Impact, but Give Up Your Life
Pro: Spent three years on the hiring team & found the hacky whacky culture fun for the most part. Key to success is forging the right relationships. Be sure to manage your own career because no one will do it for you.
Con: Politics abound, lack of management training, questionable review cycles, erratic tangible roadmap outside of high-level ideas

Title: Amazing place
Pro: Compensation, Great talent, a lot of space to be creative and submit ideas, not a lot of hierarchy and politics yet, ability to switch teams easily.
Con: A lot of product ideas get killed and never ship, which is usual for a company this size as you can't just ship half-baked products.

Title: High competition, a lot of bad quality projects
Pro: Ability to work with the world-size project audience. Scaling of your products to the billions of users.
Con: Technology stack of the company is very specific. Be sure to select proper project, and not some legacy stuff

Title: Open, Connected, & Diverse
Pro: You can be who you really are and no pretense. Every day is a new learning experience with wonderful opportunities to grow.
Con: Great placr to work! Can't think of any!

Title: Great place to learn from the best
Pro:
- Smart people
- Amazing infra to build on
- Merit driven culture
Con: #NAME?

Title: Best
Pro: Amazing people, culture, product, and collaboration model. Very happy at the company overall and impressed w the vision. Love the company.
Con: Compensation is below par for those who have been at the company beyond their vesting period or who have internally transferred

Title: Amazing place to work
Pro: You get to interact with smart people, use high-level analytical skills to solve complex problems, and access unparalleled resources, perks, and food. This is a fantastic place to work.
Con: The company is growing quickly and a challenge will be to maintain the great culture.

Title: Good place to learn
Pro: I work with a lot of smart people and I learn a lot from them
Con: It is not a lot of fun and the review process gets on the way on getting things done

Title: Best Company Ever
Pro: The efficiency that Facebook runs, at their scale, is amazing. Some people bash on FB design teams, saying it's messy/broken, but think of all the effort it must take for a company with that many designers to sync up. It's phenomenal what they do.
Con: None. I love everything so far.

Title: Still a challenging place to work
Pro: Plenty to do and learn, if you can stay focused amid the management and org communication problems. More so than ever, it matters a lot where in the company you land. Still the smartest people I've ever worked with!
Con: More middle managers, more barriers to entry, slower innovation.

Title: Great place to work and meet awesome coworkers!
Pro:
- people are smart
- amazing perks (insurance, free food, shuttle)
- great training system (I've learnt a lot!)
- clear career path
- culture
Con:
- sometimes too much noise
- sometimes too much work

Title: Great Onboarding Process
Pro:
*Truly feels like a mission driven company
*Tremendous support for people
*Open culture
Con:
*It's a big company, so it is impossible to know everything that might be relevant
*The open culture means there is a ton of conversation which can make it difficult to figure out what is relevant and what is not

Title: Facebook is fun and cool, but not always an environment that encourages growth.
Pro: the free food, really bright employees
Con: some of the employees feel a sense of entitlement that comes through in day-to-day interactions...very young upper level management..inexperience shows

Title: Most fun and rewarding job I've ever had.
Pro: smart people, challenging projects, refreshing to be with co-workers that love coming to work each day
Con: in a move fast culture, things are always changing and you have to roll with the punches

Title: The smartest people, working together to solve client's problems on the largest marketing stage, delivering results.
Pro: Clear vision, talented/diverse employees, awesome benefits, solid upper management/leadership
Con: Constant change, media underdog, weak lower management

Title: This is absolutely the best company to work for!
Pro:
The people. The work. The culture. The perks. The CEO. 

# ^ $
Con: Some code is messy (but a lot isn't). The branding could use some love.

Title: OK, but...
Pro: Perks are mind-blowing - awesome food, and thoughtful benefits like laundry service and onsite acupuncture/clinic.
Con: Frenetic pace, which isn't bad by itself.  But PROCESS is a four letter word at Facebook, clearly moving fast and breaking things is considered the way to go.  Sorry, but when a company hits 12,000 people you gotta add in at least a light layer of process and actually hold people accountable to follow it.

Title: Great company
Pro: Fun, challenging, collaborative. The campus is also amazing, and interns are treated very well.
Con: The company is getting big, and even though the company tries hard to not be affected by "corporate" culture, some of it is unavoidable it seems.

Title: Facebook
Pro: Great place to work. Collaborative and encouraging management team. Rewarding for people who take risks and produce. Benefits and lifestyle are the best you'll ever see.
Con: Hard to say there are any negatives at a place like Facebook.

Title: General Statement about the Tech Industry
Pro: Pinnacle of Industry, work with the passionately intelligent people.
Con: Disneyland Capitalism, fun and games on the surface with a monolithic corporation underneath.

Title: Smart People, Great Culture
Pro: The Perks are nice, but what is very valuable is the people I work with.  Everyone is top notch and I'm learning a lot every day.
Con: There are a lot of people who touch each project making it hard to execute quickly.

Pro: Strong leadership. Lots of autonomy. Intelligent and caring colleagues.
Con: It doesn't matter how hard working you're you are going to be surrounded with a lot of other people who are just as good as you're

Title: Manager, Enterprise Engineering
Pro: Fantastic environment!  Awesome people!  Great food!  Extremely supportive!  Unbelievable Tech!
Con: Large tech stack to learn that is still Facebook specific in many cases even though much has been open sourced.  More outdated documentation exists than I would like.

Title: What a wonderful place
Pro:
- Flexible work hours
- Supportive management / leaders
- Transparency 
- Collaborative teams
- Growth opportunities galore 
- Food, gyms, other perks
- High pay
Con: - Imposter syndrome (but this is not a company faulted thing, it's just the fact that we work amongst some of the smartest and most talented people in the world)

Title: Great place to work
Pro: Great work culture. People here are very understanding and are invested in your learning. There's a lot of room to grow here, and the benefits are the best out of any company I've worked for
Con: Not that many. I'm not a fan of writing code in PHP/hack, but there are other options.

Title: Open culture
Pro:
1. Great team matching process called bootcamp when you have couple months to talk to different team and shop round before making the decision about which team to join.
2. Fairly easy to internally change teams to try different things and keep growth.
3. Great cafes.
Con: Depending on teams, some team may have bad work life balance.

Title: Emphasized More on Impact than Engineer Excellency
Pro:
- Great Facility & Perks
- Competitive Compensation
Con: -  The company is too big and communications are valued far more important than technical skills. Impact focused culture makes the management rewards people who spent more time talking/writing docs, having meetings. It's getting more and more political. H

Title: wonderful place to work
Pro:
-management is approachable and open with information
-perks are outstanding (health, pto, food, company events, laundry services, etc)
-employees are among the brightest in the industry
-exciting work environment
Con:
-inconsistency in quality reviews
-rapid employee growth means less personal peer-to-peer relationships

Title: Facebook Experience
Pro: Facebooks teams are driven to connect the world.
Con: The Facebook IT team needs to be less hierarchical and open to new ideas from their workers.

Title: High Quality Employment
Pro: FB tries to eliminate regular discomforts one can experience in less progressive corporate employment. Management is easy-going but in return one is expected to do quality work.
Con: FB is a large company and with that, it is sometimes hard to see the impact of the work given.

Title: Nice
Pro:
Great perks, friendly work environment, free food and gym.
The company moves fast, nice opportunities to learn and improve yourself.
Con: The company is more focused on web development and has less product/project diversity than other companies like Google or Microsoft.

Title: Leadership and Culture
Pro: Being a part of something great, on both a local and global scale. Great perks, even as a contractor.
Con: Practice what you and leadership preaches. Lack of authenticity.

Title: I've worked at a lot of places; this is the best
Pro: Coworkers are really smart, politics is minimal, and focus is on what you can accomplish that will help the company.
Con: If you're working in California, the rent and commute aren't great. The East coast offices are where its at.

Title: Some of the most amazing people I've encountered!
Pro:
- Incredible colleagues
- Senior managements is unbelievably transparent, honest and accountable. 
- A lot of people are very mission-oriented
- Great place to build the products of the future
Con: Rent around the company HQ is super high.

Title: Biggest Con: It's So Great Working Here, You Will Never Want To Leave
Pro:
- generous compensation/benefits
- manager support and transparency
- autonomy - you can create your own career path
- interesting, challenging work
- investment from the company to create/maintain a great culture
Con: - The company is growing so fast, it's hard to scale at this pace

Title: Enterprise Engineer
Pro:
Awesome perks
Exciting and dynamic environment
Great learning experience
Very causal and friendly employees
Chance to work with the best in the world
Con: At Every step, have to learn by yourself. Everything is mostly self service. So its hard if you not good with technology.

Title: Great company to work at!
Con: I can't really see any cons apart from the headquarters being in Menlo Park. I wish they would open more infrastructure engineering roles on the San Francisco office as well.

Title: Seemingly exciting but mid management is composed of a bunch of kids
Pro: pay is good, perks are good and it looks good on your resume
Con: multiple groups working on the same thing competing with each other for recognition. mid management is extremely inexperienced and immature.

Title: It's the best job I've ever had.
Pro: The culture and environment is amazing.  Everyone is empowered and responsible, there's no politics or overly restrictive processes or oppressive management oversite.
Con: The pace can be exhausting.  It can be very stressful.  You have to get used to all the media attention and mudslinging.

Title: Great Place to work
Pro:
Fast paced
Exciting projects
Fast expansion (Still)
Transparent Environment
Nice and kind managers
thoughtful management 

Career opportunity is definitely better than Google but fewer than other start ups.
But a lot of great people to learn from.
Con: bonus is not as high as I thought and seems no stock refresh program?

Title: Awesome place to work
Pro: Work on a product used by Billions, run by a CEO and executive team of rockstars. Mission driven, Flexible, cutting edge products used by people, developers, publishers, advertisers etc. Awesome perks.
Con: Long commute from SF to HQ, Company getting large now and it's harder to work on most impactful products.

Title: Never Gonna Give You Up
Pro: Personal and family leave, growth opportunities, open environment, friendly atmosphere, work from home Wednesdays, ethical business practices, unlimited sick days, diverse staff.
Con: You need to love what you're doing here because it moves FAST.

Title: Great if you are young...
Pro: Great perks, interesting challenges, dynamic environment
Con: Open floor plan is not for everyone, hard to concentrate

Title: Great place to work
Pro: I work on things that I find very interesting and have few boundaries towards success. The perks/benefits are huge, and I really appreciate the free meals.
Con: Can err on the sides of being too results oriented half to half, and I am worried about the company's direction in open source.

Title: Great culture and leadership from the top
Pro: #NAME?
Con: There are bad eggs anywhere, but FB generally does a good job of calling those people out. Sometimes we overpivot on the feelings aspect and lose some good people.

Title: Positive Feedback
Pro:
Best company for an intern! Everything is free and there is a good hotel to live!
Worked on an independent project. (This is really good compare to some interns in Canada..)
Con:
Really good company and no big cons..
Ok.. food is not good as heard..

Title: Amazing place
Pro: Compensation, Great talent, a lot of space to be creative and submit ideas, not a lot of hierarchy and politics yet, ability to switch teams easily.
Con: A lot of product ideas get killed and never ship, which is usual for a company this size as you can't just ship half-baked products.

Title: High competition, a lot of bad quality projects
Pro: Ability to work with the world-size project audience. Scaling of your products to the billions of users.
Con: Technology stack of the company is very specific. Be sure to select proper project, and not some legacy stuff

Title: Open, Connected, & Diverse
Pro: You can be who you really are and no pretense. Every day is a new learning experience with wonderful opportunities to grow.
Con: Great placr to work! Can't think of any!

Title: Great place to learn from the best
Pro:
- Smart people
- Amazing infra to build on
- Merit driven culture
Con: #NAME?

Title: Best
Pro: Amazing people, culture, product, and collaboration model. Very happy at the company overall and impressed w the vision. Love the company.
Con: Compensation is below par for those who have been at the company beyond their vesting period or who have internally transferred

Title: Amazing place to work
Pro: You get to interact with smart people, use high-level analytical skills to solve complex problems, and access unparalleled resources, perks, and food. This is a fantastic place to work.
Con: The company is growing quickly and a challenge will be to maintain the great culture.

Title: Good place to learn
Pro: I work with a lot of smart people and I learn a lot from them
Con: It is not a lot of fun and the review process gets on the way on getting things done

Title: Best Company Ever
Pro: The efficiency that Facebook runs, at their scale, is amazing. Some people bash on FB design teams, saying it's messy/broken, but think of all the effort it must take for a company with that many designers to sync up. It's phenomenal what they do.
Con: None. I love everything so far.

Title: Still a challenging place to work
Pro: Plenty to do and learn, if you can stay focused amid the management and org communication problems. More so than ever, it matters a lot where in the company you land. Still the smartest people I've ever worked with!
Con: More middle managers, more barriers to entry, slower innovation.

Title: Great place to work and meet awesome coworkers!
Pro:
- people are smart
- amazing perks (insurance, free food, shuttle)
- great training system (I've learnt a lot!)
- clear career path
- culture
Con:

- sometimes too much work

*It's a big company, so it is impossible to know everything that might be relevant
